alert.note: Alert for Clark; Clay; Coles; Cumberland; Douglas; Edgar; Effingham; Jasper (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 9:11PM CDT until March 31 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT FOR EASTERN COLES...EDGAR...WESTERN JASPER...NORTHWESTERN CLARK... CUMBERLAND...CLAY...SOUTHEASTERN EFFINGHAM AND EASTERN DOUGLAS COUNTIES... At 911 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Hume to Louisville, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Hume around 915 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Chrisman, Clay City and Bogota. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 108 and 133. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for south central, southeastern and east central Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Clark; Clay; Coles; Cumberland; Douglas; Edgar; Effingham; Jasper
